subject: RE: Event Contract 07/14/2024
text:
Subject: Final Preparations for Tomorrow's Event

Hi Jada,

I hope this email finds you excited for tomorrow's event! We're getting ready to welcome you and your guests to the Moonlight Lounge tomorrow, starting at 8:00 PM and going until 12:00 AM.

Just a quick recap of the details to confirm:

* Event date: Tomorrow, July 14th, from 8:00 PM to 12:00 AM
* Room: Lounge 
* Number of guests: 30-35

The kitchen will be open until about 10:00 PM. 

We're looking forward to seeing you and your guests tomorrow night! If you have any questions or concerns, please don't hesitate to reach out.

Best,
TacoTaco Events

subject: Re: Thursday Event
text:
Great! I think the set up time will be a bit of a challenge because there
is a conflict. I'm going to loop in the owner, Luan.

On Wed, Nov 29, 2023, 8:03 p.m. Kreative Kulture <
kreativekultureto@gmail.com> wrote:

> Hi right now we're expecting about 20 people with tickets. Hopefully that
> number grows and there's also lots more at the door. I will have someone
> taking money for entry at the door as well.
>
> I have a VIP table of 4 sold (front and centre.
>
> Doors are 8pm we will start arriving at 6:30.
>
> Kage Wolfe
> Kulture Artistic Director
>
> On Tue, Nov 28, 2023, 16:55 <info@eattaco.ca> wrote:
>
>> Hey Kage,
>>
>>

subject: City Water Shut Off
text:
Hi everybody, the city just gave us notice an hour ago that water will be
shut off for 6 hours today. This follows other unplanned shut offs yesterday
and the night before; so I'm not sure whether the water work will be done
tomorrow.

 

I just wanted to let you know that your event will still go ahead as
planned. We're planning on buying large 155L water tanks to store backup
water. If there is a water interruption during your event, we will manually
refill water in washrooms, have back up water to wash dishes, and have water
bottles available for guests. 

 

I'm sorry about and we'll do everything we can to minimize any issues!

subject: Re: City Water Shut Off
text:
Hi there! Please disregard my last email. Water has been restored so
everything will be fine!

On Thu, Aug 17, 2023, 1:41 p.m. <info@eattaco.ca> wrote:

> Hi everybody, the city just gave us notice an hour ago that water will be
> shut off for 6 hours today. This follows other unplanned shut offs

subject: Moonlight Lounge NYE Cancellation
text:
Hi everybody, 

 

I'm sorry to say that our NYE has been cancelled. This weekend's storm did a
lot of damage to our plumbing and patio. Specifically, the water pipes froze
and some bursted, and the enclosed patio was hit hard by the 80+kph winds.
While we could likely get most repairs done by the 31st, there was a chance
that some repairs may bleed into January so we didn't want to risk
cancelling last minute and ruining your NYE plans. A full refund has been
issued via Eventbrite.

 

Thank you for your interest. Merry Christmas and have a Happy New Year!
